posts.commentary:
New year, new opportunity! We are now strengthening our team with a PhD student in applied mathematics and machine learning within the DTCC. 

This is an exciting chance to join us and work at the intersection of rigorous mathematics, modern AI, and large-scale software development, focusing on topology-correct 3D reconstruction of cities from multi-modal geospatial data. The research will contribute directly to open-source tools in the DTCC Platform and be validated on real urban data together with public and industrial partners.

The position is fully funded for four years \(with the possibility of extension through teaching\) and based at the @[Department of Mathematical Sciences, Gothenburg](urn:li:organization:103896810). We are looking for candidates with a strong background in mathematics, solid coding skills, and an interest in geometry processing, machine learning, and urban digital twins.

We look forward to your application before the 23rd of February! 

Read more and apply: https://lnkd.in/d78-nKBp

original_data.author: urn:li:organization:100491988

posts.commentary:
On Friday we hosted the kick-off meeting for the PhD project Mixed Realities and Building Simulations for Sustainable Cities! This project explores how mixed reality \(MR\) can make urban planning and design more collaborative and engaging. By combining virtual and physical models, we aim to visualize simulation results such as wind, air pollution, noise, energy, daylight, and embodied carbon, from single buildings to entire neighbourhoods. Leading the project is @[Alexander Hollberg](urn:li:person:Vf3wqQAlwB), together with @[Sanjay Somanath](urn:li:person:QdW58Vi6c4), @[Jieming YAN](urn:li:person:02TksuXk-Y), and @[Arvid Hall](urn:li:person:2Bo8n1U3Qw), from the Research Area @[Sustainable Built Environments](urn:li:organization:84357770).

The project also marks the launch of our new Mixed Reality Studio at @[Chalmers Department of Architecture and Civil Engineering](urn:li:organization:105773234), supported by technology from DTCC. The studio will explore how immersive visualization can support better planning and decision-making and contribute to new and existing visualization labs, such as @[Universeum](urn:li:organization:3529472).

Present at Friday’s kickoff were our great partners @[Twinfinity](urn:li:organization:93112136), @[Fraunhofer-Chalmers Centre for Industrial Mathematics](urn:li:organization:872286), @[Visual Arena](urn:li:organization:38088874)/@[Lindholmen Science Park](urn:li:organization:2395819), @[Högskolan Väst](urn:li:organization:809370) and @[Sofia University St. Kliment Ohridski](urn:li:organization:1037568)/@[GATE Institute](urn:li:organization:29283368). We look forward to working together, along with @[Liljewall](urn:li:organization:3768270) and @[Göteborgs Stad](urn:li:organization:164101).

This project is part of an ongoing collaboration between DTCC and @[InfraVis](urn:li:organization:91514167), the national infrastructure for data visualization. Many thanks to both the Gothenburg and Linkoping nodes for their continuous support!

{hashtag|\#|MixedReality} {hashtag|\#|DigitalTwin} {hashtag|\#|UrbanPlanning} {hashtag|\#|Visualization} {hashtag|\#|DTCC} {hashtag|\#|Chalmers}

posts.commentary:
A couple of days ago, we had the pleasure of welcoming a Brazilian innovation delegation to Chalmers. Our coordinator @[Bernd Ketzler](urn:li:person:qCF20l2VxW) presented the work being done in DTCC together with @[Eric Jeansson](urn:li:person:WnP1lt0iLN) from @[Göteborgs Stad](urn:li:organization:164101). The presentation was part of a wider program organised by @[Innovair™](urn:li:organization:10163266) and @[CISB](urn:li:organization:2310412) – the Swedish-Brazilian Research and Innovation Centre, bringing together representatives from government, academia, and industry in both countries.

It was a great day of exchanging ideas on how digital technologies can drive the transition towards smarter and more liveable cities.

original_data.author: urn:li:organization:100491988

posts.commentary:
Did you miss the kick-off of DTCC2 a couple of weeks ago? Now you can view all the presentations again! Listen to our partners @[Dessislava Petrova-Antonova](urn:li:person:qfjiOFvUw5) from @[GATE Institute](urn:li:organization:29283368), @[Helen Eriksson](urn:li:person:\_6-JjN2dBg) and Thomas Lithén from @[Lantmäteriet](urn:li:organization:164681) give their insights on why digital twins is important to their organizations. You'll also hear from research leads @[Malgorzata Zboinska, PhD](urn:li:person:tkUKE5aPw8), @[Alexander Hollberg](urn:li:person:Vf3wqQAlwB), @[Franziska Hunger](urn:li:person:RqCpkr5\_SS), @[Mattias Roupé](urn:li:person:gpg-vzsrfh), @[Dag Wästberg](urn:li:person:cx\_7GyIzPN) and @[Anders Logg](urn:li:person:kh7K8aieoy) about what projects will be the focus for the upcoming period.

https://lnkd.in/d\_ASVwRk

posts.commentary:
After three years of EU-funded research and co-creation with cities across Europe, the CREATE project is concluding with the launch of its final outcome: the CREATE Tool. This interactive tool supports circular urban planning by mapping and visualizing buildings’ material stocks and flows. It has been piloted in Gothenburg, Rennes, and Vienna, and is designed for use by city planners, policy makers, and sustainability professionals.

The CREATE team will present the tool and key project outcomes in a public webinar on June 12th, 11:30–12:30 CET - don't miss out!

CREATE is a project within the @[Driving Urban Transitions Partnership](urn:li:organization:86886063) \(DUT\), involving @[Chalmers tekniska högskola](urn:li:organization:5074), @[Wageningen University & Research](urn:li:organization:166859), @[AIT Austrian Institute of Technology](urn:li:organization:526248), @[CitéSource](urn:li:organization:44677580), @[BRGM](urn:li:organization:37165), the Municipality of Nijmegen, and @[Göteborgs Stad](urn:li:organization:164101).

Register here: https://lnkd.in/dKFDCdxE

original_data.author: urn:li:organization:100491988

posts.commentary:
DTCC 2 is live! Earlier today, the kick-off for the next five years of the @[Digital Twin Cities Centre](urn:li:organization:100491988) took place, and gathered many of our amazing partners and colleagues at @[Visual Arena](urn:li:organization:38088874) in Gothenburg and online. We got to listen to great presentations from our partners @[Dessislava Petrova-Antonova](urn:li:person:qfjiOFvUw5), Research Lead at @[GATE Institute](urn:li:organization:29283368), and @[Helen Eriksson](urn:li:person:\_6-JjN2dBg) and Thomas Lithén from @[Lantmäteriet](urn:li:organization:164681). We also got an insight to what the new projects within the centre will focus on going forward, given by research leads @[Malgorzata Zboinska, PhD](urn:li:person:tkUKE5aPw8), @[Alexander Hollberg](urn:li:person:Vf3wqQAlwB), @[Mattias Roupé](urn:li:person:gpg-vzsrfh), @[Franziska Hunger](urn:li:person:RqCpkr5\_SS), @[Dag Wästberg](urn:li:person:cx\_7GyIzPN) and @[Anders Logg](urn:li:person:kh7K8aieoy). 

Thanks to everyone participating today! @[Ale kommun](urn:li:organization:3730042) @[Chalmers tekniska högskola](urn:li:organization:5074) @[Chalmers Industriteknik](urn:li:organization:331364) @[Democritus University of Thrace - \(D.U.Th.\)](urn:li:organization:15092734) @[Doing Good](urn:li:organization:18756617) @[Fraunhofer-Chalmers Centre for Industrial Mathematics](urn:li:organization:872286) @[GATE Institute](urn:li:organization:29283368) @[Gdańsk University of Technology](urn:li:organization:15096515) @[Halmstads kommun](urn:li:organization:55419) @[Helsingborgs stad](urn:li:organization:44290) @[Höganäs kommun I Entreprenörskap, kompetensförsörjning & näringsliv](urn:li:organization:447727) @[Kungsbacka kommun](urn:li:organization:68946) @[Lantmäteriet](urn:li:organization:164681) @[Liljewall](urn:li:organization:3768270) @[Lindholmen Science Park](urn:li:organization:2395819) @[Lunds universitet](urn:li:organization:5077) @[NCC](urn:li:organization:5276) @[Norges teknisk-naturvitenskapelige universitet \(NTNU\)](urn:li:organization:15097165) @[Ramboll](urn:li:organization:165649) @[Skanska](urn:li:organization:4335) @[Sveriges Kommuner och Regioner](urn:li:organization:38028) @[Sweco](urn:li:organization:13939) @[Twinfinity AB](urn:li:organization:93112136) @[University of Patras](urn:li:organization:19843) University of Salento @[University of the Aegean](urn:li:organization:166682) @[Högskolan Väst](urn:li:organization:809370) @[WINNIIO AB](urn:li:organization:26197477)

posts.commentary:
Ending the year with some great news! We're excited to announce that our five-year extension will begin in 2025, with approval from @[Vinnova](urn:li:organization:20735). This next phase will focus on advancing sustainable urban development through cutting-edge research, industry collaboration, and practical tools that transform how cities are planned and built. Together with our partners, we’re committed to shaping smarter, greener, and more inclusive cities for the future.

posts.commentary: Did you know that urban densification affects wind, heat, noise, and air quality at every level, from city blocks to individual streets? How can urban planners ensure these environmental factors are accounted for in their designs? These, and many more questions were investigated by @[Franziska Hunger](urn:li:person:RqCpkr5\_SS) and the team working in the DTCC Milestone Project called Urban Environmental Comfort Design. Read more on our website.

original_data.author: urn:li:organization:100491988

article.description: Urban densification influences wind, temperature, noise, daylight and air quality in both city scales and microscales like streets, neighbourhoods, parks. While software for wind simulation is available and best-practise guidelines have been...

posts.commentary:
Exciting news! @[Digital Twin Cities Centre](urn:li:organization:100491988) have received approval to continue our research for another five years. We have successfully completed numerous projects and are now planning for the future! 

- We’re very proud and happy with the results produced within the centre so far. We’ve had the pleasure of working with many engaged partners who see great benefit in using our research results as an important step in moving into the future of design and construction. Together with them and our skilled colleagues we are hoping to produce many more important insights over the next five years, says @[Anders Logg](urn:li:person:kh7K8aieoy), director of Digital Twin Cities Centre. 

Read the full story on our website.

original_data.author: urn:li:organization:100491988

article.description: The Digital Twin Cities Centre has received approval to continue its research for another five years. The centre has successfully completed numerous projects and is now planning for the future. Digital Twin Cities Centre has been given the green light...
article.title: Five more years for Digital Twin Cities Center

original_data.commentary:
Exciting news! @[Digital Twin Cities Centre](urn:li:organization:100491988) have received approval to continue our research for another five years. We have successfully completed numerous projects and are now planning for the future! 

- We’re very proud and happy with the results produced within the centre so far. We’ve had the pleasure of working with many engaged partners who see great benefit in using our research results as an important step in moving into the future of design and construction. Together with them and our skilled colleagues we are hoping to produce many more important insights over the next five years, says @[Anders Logg](urn:li:person:kh7K8aieoy), director of Digital Twin Cities Centre. 

Read the full story on our website.
@[Bernd Ketzler](urn:li:person:qCF20l2VxW) @[Minna Karstunen](urn:li:person:08o21EqG70) @[Vasilis Naserentin](urn:li:person:7GS74ZGr6j)
